Trump]] (2005-present) |children = Barron Trump (b. 2006); four stepchildren from Trump's previous marriages |nationality = {{SLO}} |occupation = Model, socialite, jewelry designer |yearsactive = 1986âpresent }} '''Melania Knauss-Trump''' (born '''Melanija Knavs''', [[germanized]] to '''Melania Knauss'''; April 26, 1970<ref>{{cite news|title=Melania Knauss Biography|url=http://www.starpulse.com/Supermodels/Knauss,_Melania/Biography/|accessdate=2 May 2011|newspaper=Star Pulse}}</ref>) is a [[Slovenia]]n former [[model (person)|model]] and the wife of American [[real estate]] [[business magnate|magnate]] [[Donald Trump]]. They married on January 22, 2005.<ref>{{cite news|title=Melania Knauss|url=http://www.askmen.com/celebs/women/models_200/230_melania_knauss.html|accessdate=2 May 2011|newspaper=Ask Men}}</ref>
== Career == After obtaining a degree in design and architecture{{Citation needed|date=May 2011}} at the [[University of Ljubljana]], she started working as a model both in [[Milan]] and [[Paris]] before settling in [[New York City]] in 1996. She was on the cover of ''[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]'', ''[[Harper's Bazaar]]'', ''[[Ocean Drive (magazine)|Ocean Drive]]'', ''In Style'', ''[[New York (magazine)|New York Magazine]]'', ''Avenue'', ''[[Allure (magazine)|Allure]]'', ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'', ''[[Self (magazine)|Self]]'', ''[[Glamour (magazine)|Glamour]]'', ''[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]'', and appeared in the 2000 ''[[Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue]]''.
In February 2010, Knauss-Trump announced the launch of a jewellery collection with [[QVC]]. Knauss appeared in a television advertisement for [[Aflac]] insurance, in which she and the Aflac mascot, a duck, voiced by comedian [[Gilbert Gottfried]], exchange personalities via a [[Frankenstein]]-like mad experiment.
==Personal life== Knauss-Trump was born in the town of [[Sevnica]] in [[Slovenia]]'s [[Lower Sava Valley]] (then part of [[SFR Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]]) in 1970. Her father Viktor Knavs was from the nearby town of [[RadeÄe]], while her mother Amalija came from a village in the area surrounding Sevnica.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.celjan.si/index.php?pid=64 |title=Tednik CELJAN |publisher=Celjan.si |date= |accessdate=2011-11-25}}</ref>
===Relationship with Donald Trump=== Knauss's relationship with Trump grew as she continued to model, and also became involved with the social set of New York. Their relationship received increasing publicity after the launch of Trump's successful business-oriented [[reality television]] show, ''[[The Apprentice (U.S. TV series)|The Apprentice]]''.
She appeared on ''[[The Howard Stern Show]]'' with Trump. This led to a layout in British ''[[GQ (magazine)|GQ magazine]]'', including the cover shot in January 2000.
Trump and Knauss became engaged in 2004, and married on January 22, 2005 at [[Episcopal Church (United States)|The Episcopal Church]] of Bethesda-by-the-Sea in [[Palm Beach, Florida]], followed by a reception at Trump's [[Mar-A-Lago]] estate. Their wedding ceremony was widely covered by the [[Mass media|media]], with the fact that Knauss wore a $200,000 [[wedding dress|dress]] made by the house of [[Christian Dior]] often mentioned. The cake at the reception was a 50-pound orange [[Grand Marnier]] cake with a Grand Marnier butter-cream filling, covered with 3,000 roses, constructed by the chef at Mar-A-Lago.
On March 20, 2006, Knauss-Trump gave birth to a boy, whom the couple named Barron William Trump. Donald Trump made the announcement via phone on the ''[[Imus in the Morning]]'' show about 20 minutes after birth, stating that "everyone's perfect". It was Trump's fifth child.
====Promoting Trump's presidential goals==== When husband Donald Trump announced presidential ambitions, Melania Trump began helping. Reports in the media state: "Melania Trump is already pondering her role as a possible First Lady - all while plugging her QVC line of sparkly baubles."<ref>{{cite news|last=Goldwert|first=Lindsay|title=Melania Trump talks First Lady ambitions; Of Michelle Obama, 'She'd look great in my QVC jewelry'|url=http://articles.nydailynews.com/2011-04-25/entertainment/29492131_1_first-lady-michelle-obama-trump-style|accessdate=2 May 2011|newspaper=New York Daily News|date=April 25, 2011}}</ref> "Melania Trump will stand by her husband whether he decides to run for president or not."<ref>{{cite news|title=Melania Trump Talks Obama's Birth Certificate, First Lady Possibility|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/04/21/melania-trump-talks-obama_n_852154.html|accessdate=2 May 2011|newspaper=Huffington Post|date=04/21/11}}</ref> And speculation about: "Would Melania Trump Be the Hottest First Lady Ever?"<ref>{{cite news|title=Would Melania Trump Be the Hottest First Lady Ever?|url=http://www.sodahead.com/entertainment/would-melania-trump-be-the-hottest-first-lady-ever/question-1707527/|accessdate=2 May 2011|newspaper=sodahead.com|date=April 22, 2011}}</ref>
